closedGuard.name: Armbar
closedGuard.description: Attack the opponent's arm by trapping it between your legs and extending your hips.
steps: Secure the opponent's arm by gripping their wrist with both hands.
Place your foot on their hip and pivot your body to create an angle.
Swing your leg over their head while keeping their arm tight to your chest.
Pinch your knees together and pull their arm down.
Extend your hips to apply pressure on the elbow joint.

closedGuard.name: Triangle Choke
closedGuard.description: Trap the opponent's arm and head between your legs, creating a choke with your legs and the opponent's shoulder.
steps: Shoot one leg over the opponent's shoulder and lock your ankles.
Grab your shin with the opposite hand to maintain control.
Place your foot on their hip and adjust your angle by shrimping out.
Re-cross your legs, placing your knee pit over your shin.
Squeeze your knees together, lift your hips, and pull down on their head if necessary.

closedGuard.name: Kimura
closedGuard.description: Isolate and control the opponent's arm, bending it behind their back to apply pressure on the shoulder joint.
steps: Grip the opponent's wrist with your same-side hand.
Reach over their arm with your other hand and grab your own wrist.
Pull their arm across their body and towards their back.
Place your foot on their hip and pivot to create an angle.
Apply pressure by lifting their wrist and pushing their elbow towards their head.

closedGuard.name: Omoplata
closedGuard.description: Trap the opponent's arm with your legs and use your hips to apply pressure on their shoulder.
steps: Isolate the opponent's arm by trapping it with your legs.
Place your foot on their hip and pivot to create an angle.
Swing your leg over their shoulder and lock your ankles.
Use your hips to apply pressure on their shoulder.
Maintain control and adjust your grip as needed.

closedGuard.name: Cross Collar Choke
closedGuard.description: Grip the opponent's collar with both hands and apply pressure on both sides of their neck to choke.
steps: Grip the opponent's collar with one hand, palm up.
Grip the other side of their collar with your other hand, palm down.
Pull their collar tight to apply pressure on their neck.
Squeeze your elbows together to increase the choke.
Maintain control and adjust your grip as needed.

openGuard.name: De La Riva Guard
openGuard.description: Hook one leg around the opponent's leg while controlling their ankle or pants for various sweeps and submissions.
steps: Hook your outside leg around the opponent's leg.
Control their ankle or pants with your hand.
Use your other foot to push on their hip or thigh.
Pull their ankle towards you while pushing with your foot.
Sweep them by extending your hooked leg and pulling their ankle.

openGuard.name: Spider Guard
openGuard.description: Control the opponent's sleeves while placing your feet on their biceps to create distance and set up sweeps or submissions.
steps: Grip both of the opponent's sleeves.
Place your feet on their biceps, extending your legs to create distance.
Use your legs to control their arms and off-balance them.
Push and pull with your legs to manipulate their posture.
Transition to sweeps or submissions as openings arise.

openGuard.name: Butterfly Guard
openGuard.description: Use your feet inside the opponent's thighs to elevate and sweep them or transition to other positions.
steps: Sit up and place your feet inside the opponent's thighs.
Grip their sleeves or collar for control.
Use your legs to lift and off-balance them.
Lean back and pull them towards you while lifting with your legs.
Sweep them to the side and transition to a dominant position.

openGuard.name: X-Guard
openGuard.description: Control the opponent's leg and arm with your legs in an X-shape, creating sweeps and submission opportunities.
steps: Sit up and place one leg over the opponent's leg and the other under their arm.
Grip their sleeve or collar for control.
Use your legs to control their limbs and off-balance them.
Push and pull with your legs to manipulate their posture.
Transition to sweeps or submissions as openings arise.

halfGuard.name: Underhook Half Guard Sweep
halfGuard.description: Use an underhook to sweep the opponent from the half guard position.
steps: Establish half guard position with an underhook on the opponent's arm.
Grip their sleeve or collar with your other hand.
Use your underhook to control their posture and off-balance them.
Kick your underhook leg out and sweep them to the side.
Transition to a dominant position or submission.

halfGuard.name: Half Guard Pass
halfGuard.description: Pass the opponent's half guard to establish side control or mount.
steps: Establish a strong base and posture in the half guard position.
Control the opponent's hips and legs to prevent sweeps.
Create space by pushing their knee away or stepping over their leg.
Maintain control and pass to side control or mount.
Secure the dominant position and look for submissions.

sideControl.name: Americana
sideControl.description: Control the opponent's arm, bending it at a right angle, and apply pressure to the elbow joint.
steps: Isolate the opponent's arm by pinning it to the mat.
Grip their wrist with your same-side hand.
Slide your other hand under their arm and grab your own wrist.
Lift their elbow while keeping their wrist pinned to the mat.
Apply pressure by pushing their wrist towards their head.

sideControl.name: Arm Triangle
sideControl.description: Trap the opponent's arm and head using your arm and chest, applying pressure on their neck to choke.
steps: Isolate the opponent's arm and head with your arm.
Grip your bicep with your opposite hand.
Place your head on the mat next to their head.
Squeeze your arms together to apply pressure on their neck.
Walk your legs towards their head to increase the choke.

sideControl.name: Knee on Belly
sideControl.description: Place your knee on the opponent's torso to increase pressure and create openings for submissions or transitions.
steps: Transition to knee-on-belly by placing your knee on their torso.
Control their collar or sleeve with your hands.
Apply pressure by driving your knee into their torso.
Maintain balance by keeping your other foot on the mat.
Look for openings to transition to submissions or other positions.

sideControl.name: Transition to Mount
sideControl.description: Transition from side control to the mounted position.
steps: Establish a strong side control position.
Control the opponent's hips and shoulders to prevent movement.
Step over their head and place your knee on the mat.
Bring your other leg over and establish the mounted position.
Secure the mount and look for submissions or transitions.

mount.name: Armbar from Mount
mount.description: Isolate the opponent's arm and extend your hips to apply pressure on the elbow joint.
steps: Isolate the opponent's arm by gripping their wrist.
Place your foot on their hip and pivot to create an angle.
Swing your leg over their head while keeping their arm tight to your chest.
Pinch your knees together and pull their arm down.
Extend your hips to apply pressure on the elbow joint.

mount.name: Cross Collar Choke from Mount
mount.description: Grip the opponent's collar with both hands and apply pressure on both sides of their neck to choke.
steps: Grip the opponent's collar with one hand, palm up.
Grip the other side of their collar with your other hand, palm down.
Pull their collar tight to apply pressure on their neck.
Squeeze your elbows together to increase the choke.
Maintain control and adjust your grip as needed.

mount.name: Mounted Triangle
mount.description: Transition one leg over the opponent's shoulder while trapping their arm, and secure the triangle choke.
steps: Isolate the opponent's arm and head with your legs.
Shoot one leg over their shoulder and lock your ankles.
Adjust your angle by shrimping out to the side.
Re-cross your legs, placing your knee pit over your shin.
Squeeze your knees together and lift your hips to apply the choke.

backControl.name: Rear Naked Choke
backControl.description: Wrap your arm around the opponent's neck, applying pressure on both sides of their neck to choke.
steps: Wrap your arm around the opponent's neck, palm down.
Grip your bicep with your opposite hand.
Place your other hand behind their head.
Squeeze your arms together to apply pressure on their neck.
Maintain control and adjust your grip as needed.

backControl.name: Bow and Arrow Choke
backControl.description: Grip the opponent's collar and their leg, extending your legs to apply pressure on their neck to choke.
steps: Grip the opponent's collar with one hand.
Grip their leg with your other hand.
Extend your legs to create tension.
Pull their collar tight to apply pressure on their neck.
Maintain control and adjust your grip as needed.

backControl.name: Armbar from Back Control
backControl.description: Secure the opponent's arm and extend your hips to apply pressure on the elbow joint.
steps: Isolate the opponent's arm by gripping their wrist.
Place your foot on their hip and pivot to create an angle.
Swing your leg over their head while keeping their arm tight to your chest.
Pinch your knees together and pull their arm down.
Extend your hips to apply pressure on the elbow joint.

guardPasses.name: Torreando Pass
guardPasses.description: Control the opponent's legs and use lateral movement to pass their guard.
steps: Grip the opponent's pants near their knees.
Push their legs to one side while stepping to the opposite side.
Maintain control of their legs as you move around their guard.
Establish side control by pinning their hips and shoulders.
Secure your position and look for submissions or transitions.

guardPasses.name: Knee Slice Pass
guardPasses.description: Drive your knee through the opponent's guard, using pressure and control to pass.
steps: Grip the opponent's collar and pants for control.
Drive your knee through the middle of their guard.
Use your other leg to push their leg out of the way.
Establish side control by pinning their hips and shoulders.
Secure your position and look for submissions or transitions.

guardPasses.name: Over/Under Pass
guardPasses.description: Control the opponent's legs with an over/under grip to pass their guard.
steps: Grip one of the opponent's pants with an over grip and the other with an under grip.
Create space by pushing their legs apart.
Step one leg through the middle and establish side control.
Secure your position and look for submissions or transitions.

mountEscapes.name: Upa Escape
mountEscapes.description: Bridge and roll to escape the mounted position.
steps: Establish a strong base by placing your feet on the mat.
Bridge your hips up and roll to one side.
Keep your elbows tight to your body to protect your face.
Continue rolling until you escape the mount.
Establish a guard or other defensive position.

mountEscapes.name: Elbow Escape
mountEscapes.description: Use your elbows to create space and escape the mounted position.
steps: Place your elbows on the mat near your opponent's hips.
Bridge your hips up and create space with your elbows.
Shrimp or hip escape to establish a guard or other defensive position.
Maintain control and look for sweeps or submissions.

sideControlEscapes.name: Hip Escape
sideControlEscapes.description: Use your hips to create space and escape side control.
steps: Establish a strong base by placing your feet on the mat.
Bridge your hips up and create space with your hips.
Shrimp or hip escape to establish a guard or other defensive position.
Maintain control and look for sweeps or submissions.

sideControlEscapes.name: Knee Escape
sideControlEscapes.description: Use your knee to create space and escape side control.
steps: Place your knee on the mat near your opponent's hips.
Bridge your hips up and create space with your knee.
Shrimp or hip escape to establish a guard or other defensive position.
Maintain control and look for sweeps or submissions.

backControlEscapes.name: Trap and Roll Escape
backControlEscapes.description: Trap the opponent's arm and roll to escape back control.
steps: Trap the opponent's arm with your arm and leg.
Bridge your hips up and roll towards the trapped arm.
Keep your elbows tight to your body to protect your face.
Continue rolling until you escape back control.
Establish a guard or other defensive position.

backControlEscapes.name: Shrimp Escape
backControlEscapes.description: Use a shrimp motion to create space and escape back control.
steps: Establish a strong base by placing your feet on the mat.
Shrimp your hips away from the opponent to create space.
Use your arms to defend against submissions.
Continue shrimping until you escape back control.
Establish a guard or other defensive position.
